answers.answer: Byetta is for type 2 diabetics but also used for those who are insulin-resistant.  You can be insulin resistant and not be a diabetic, but it sure is a good start.  I just started the Byetta in May.  I am diabetic.  As far as weight just falling off - NO, it does not.  Since May, I have lost 10 pounds.  If I was younger, more active, etc. etc., I probably would have lost more, but the 10 pounds is an achievement when you consider the fact up until May for the last 3 years I have been gaining weight contributory to the medications of diabetes.  So, Byetta is not a weight loss miracle or a weight loss drug.

Thanks for the info.  Like I said, I watched a program on it, and the people taking Byetta dropped 30 plus lbs in 1-2 months.  THey said the intake of there food drasically diminished.  I do apprecitate your feedback.
This will probably top the charts. I use Byetta 10 twice a day and I have lost 82 lbs. in 6 weeks. How's that for wonderful? I am thrilled.

question: Has anyone heard about this Byetta Pen? It is used for type 2 Diabetes, but  I have heard there is a talk about loosing weight on it. In fact, I watched a program about it and they said the weight just falls off.  Has anyone heard of this or taken it (the pen) and not had type 2?
title: Byetta Pen
